name: Knight
description: The knight is a low-ranking noble with formal combat training. Although they may be called to fight in battle, a knight’s primary purpose is to serve for the glory of their Lord or Lady, to whom they have sworn an oath of fealty. Many knights are also accompanied by a squire, a young knight in training who may carry their lord’s banner or help them don and doff their armor.

On the battlefield, a knight is a magnificent sight, clad in expensive steel plate armor and with their lord’s ensignia emblazoned on their shield. However, some knights forgo a shield altogether, preferring a heavier two-handed weapon. Either way, knights train extensively and are rarely caught flat-footed, even when out of armor
backstoryPrompts: Did you train as a page or a squire before becoming a knight?
Are you proud of your country and your liege, or have you become disillusioned?
Was your oath of fealty inspired by love, respect, or political convenience?
How far back can you trace your lineage?
What made you leave your previous life and start adventuring?
coreAbilityDescription: You have sworn an oath to a nobleman or lady, to protect them with your life and to fight for them in battle. In return, they have provided you with a fine suit of chainmail, and several high quality steel weapons.

2: learn any two abilities from the following list:
levelingBonuses.3: your liege gifts you an improved suit of armor. You may choose a suit of {{armor.half_plate_armor}} or {{armor.splinted_chainmail}}.
levelingBonuses.4: The dexterity and speed caps on your armor are increased by 1.
levelingBonuses.6: in recognition of your glorious and heroic conduct, your liege grants you a set of steel plate armor.
levelingBonuses.7: You ignore disadvantage on mobility checks while wearing half plate armor, and ignore disadvantage on stealth checks while wearing full plate.
levelingBonuses.8: The dexterity and speed caps on your armor are further increased, from 1 to 2.
levelingBonuses.9: when you fail a saving throw against a spell, you can expend willpower (equal to the amount by which you failed the save) to instead succeed the save.
levelingBonuses.12: The dexterity and speed caps on your armor are further increased, from 2 to 3.
levelingBonuses.16: The dexterity and speed caps on your armor are further increased, from 3 to 4.
